         * false calls Neo.Main.setRoute()
         * @member {Boolean} editRoute=true

classData.description: false calls Neo.Main.setRoute()
classData.name: editRoute

classData.comment:
/**
         * Shortcut for domListeners={click:handler}.
         * A string-based value assumes that the handlerFn lives inside a controller.Component.
         *
         * This config uses a custom `isEqual` function to ensure proper reactivity.
         * When the handler is a function, it's often a closure that changes on each render
         * (e.g., in recycled components like grid cells). The default deep comparison
         * (`Neo.isEqual`) would incorrectly treat structurally identical functions as unchanged,
         * preventing updates. The custom `isEqual` forces an update for new function instances,
         * while performing a standard equality check for string-based handlers.
         * @member {Function|String|null} handler_
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description:
Shortcut for domListeners={click:handler}. A string-based value assumes that the handlerFn lives inside a controller.Component.

This config uses a custom isEqual function to ensure proper reactivity. When the handler is a function, it's often a closure that changes on each render (e.g., in recycled components like grid cells). The default deep comparison (Neo.isEqual) would incorrectly treat structurally identical functions as unchanged, preventing updates. The custom isEqual forces an update for new function instances, while performing a standard equality check for string-based handlers.
classData.name: handler_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The scope (this pointer) inside the handler function.
         * Points to the button instance by default.
         * You can use 'this' as a string for convenience reasons
         * @member {Object|String|null} handlerScope=null
         */
classData.description: The scope (this pointer) inside the handler function. Points to the button instance by default. You can use 'this' as a string for convenience reasons
classData.name: handlerScope

classData.comment:
/**

         * @member {String|null} [iconCls_=null]

classData.description: The CSS class to use for an icon, e.g. 'fa fa-home'
classData.name: iconCls_

classData.comment:

classData.description: The color to use for an icon, e.g. '#ff0000' [optional]
classData.name: iconColor_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The position of the icon in case iconCls has a value.
         * Valid values are: 'top', 'right', 'bottom', 'left'
         * @member {String} iconPosition_='left'
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: The position of the icon in case iconCls has a value. Valid values are: 'top', 'right', 'bottom', 'left'
classData.name: iconPosition_

classData.comment:
/**
         * An array representing the configuration of the menu items.
         *
         * Or a configuration object which adds custom configuration to the menu to be
         * created and includes an `items` property to define the menu items.
         * @member {Object|Object[]|null} menu_=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description:
An array representing the configuration of the menu items.

Or a configuration object which adds custom configuration to the menu to be created and includes an items property to define the menu items.
classData.name: menu_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The pressed state of the Button
         * @member {Boolean} pressed_=false
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: The pressed state of the Button
classData.name: pressed_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Change the browser hash value on click.
         * Use route for internal navigation and url for external links. Do not use both on the same instance.
         * Transforms the button tag into an a tag [optional]
         * @member {String|null} route_=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: Change the browser hash value on click. Use route for internal navigation and url for external links. Do not use both on the same instance. Transforms the button tag into an a tag [optional]
classData.name: route_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The text displayed on the button [optional]
         * You can either pass a string, or a vdom cn array.
         * @example
         *  text: [{tag: 'span', style: {color: '#bbbbbb'}, text: '●'}, {vtype: 'text', text: ' Cases'}]
         * @member {Object[]|String|null} text=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: The text displayed on the button [optional] You can either pass a string, or a vdom cn array.
classData.name: text

classData.comment:
/**
         * Transforms the button tag into an a tag [optional]
         * @member {String|null} url_=null
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: Transforms the button tag into an a tag [optional]
classData.name: url_

classData.comment:
/**
         * If url is set, applies the target attribute on the top level vdom node [optional]
         * @member {String} urlTarget_='_blank'
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: If url is set, applies the target attribute on the top level vdom node [optional]
classData.name: urlTarget_

classData.comment:
/**
         * True adds an expanding circle on click
         * @member {Boolean} useRippleEffect_=true
         * @reactive
         */
classData.description: True adds an expanding circle on click
classData.name: useRippleEffect_
